attributes.action: Allow civilians the use of reasonable force to prevent trespassing on sites storing large volumes of explosive, flammable or toxic materials (top-tier COMAH sites)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Top-tier COMAH sites are premises that store large quantities of dangerous materials; materials which have the potential to cause significant harm to people or the environment (such as large volumes of explosive, flammable or toxic chemicals).

It is currently illegal for civilian personnel to apprehend any person caught trespassing on such premises, unless they witness said person interacting with equipment on the site. The potential is that an individual entering such an establishment with the intention of sabotage or terrorism (causing an explosion in an oil storage facility, for example) cannot be touched unless such an act is witnessed.

Making such trespass a criminal offence and giving civilian security 
forces the ability to use reasonable force in apprehending and detaining those trespassing on top-tier 
COMAH sites would act as a deterrent and provide the legal ability for security personnel to prevent potential acts of industrial sabotage or terrorism.
